skill.name: istio-traffic-management
skill.description: Configure Istio traffic management including routing, load balancing, circuit breakers, and canary deployments. Use when implementing service mesh traffic policies, progressive delivery, or resilience patterns.
skill.summary: Configure Istio traffic management including routing, load balancing, circuit breakers, and canary d...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only static Markdown and JSON metadata with Istio configuration examples. No executable code, data access, or network behavior is present.

content.value_statement: Managing Istio traffic policies across services is complex and error prone. This skill provides ready templates and guidance for routing, canary rollouts, and resilience controls.
actual_capabilities: Generate VirtualService routing with header and path matches
Define DestinationRule subsets for versioned services
Set weighted splits for canary and stable traffic
Provide circuit breaker and outlier detection policies
Configure retries, timeouts, and traffic mirroring
Create Gateway and ingress routing examples
limitations: Does not apply manifests to a cluster
Requires Istio CRDs and control plane already installed
Does not validate policies against live mesh state
No runtime telemetry or rollout automation

use_cases.title: Standardize mesh routing
use_cases.description: Generate consistent VirtualService and DestinationRule patterns for team services.

use_cases.title: Harden service resilience
use_cases.description: Define retries, timeouts, and circuit breakers to reduce cascading failures.

use_cases.title: Run safe canaries
use_cases.description: Create weighted splits for stable and canary versions during rollouts.

prompt_templates.title: Basic routing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a VirtualService and DestinationRule for reviews with v1 and v2 subsets. Route header end-user jason to v2 and others to v1.

prompt_templates.title: Canary rollout
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate Istio manifests for my-service with stable and canary subsets. Use 90 percent stable and 10 percent canary.

prompt_templates.title: Resilience policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a DestinationRule with connection pools and outlier detection for my-service. Add a VirtualService with retries and timeouts.

prompt_templates.title: Ingress gateway
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Gateway for *.example.com with TLS and a VirtualService that routes /api/v1 to api-service on port 8080.

output_examples.input: Set up a 95 5 canary for payments with stable and canary subsets
output: VirtualService routes payments with 95 percent stable and 5 percent canary
DestinationRule defines stable and canary subsets with version labels
Notes on adjusting weights during the rollout

best_practices: Use clear version labels for subsets
Set conservative timeouts and retry limits
Start canaries with small traffic weights
anti_patterns: Skipping outlier detection on critical paths

faq.question: Which Istio versions are supported
faq.answer: Templates use networking v1beta1 APIs that are supported in recent Istio releases.

faq.question: What can this skill not do
faq.answer: It does not deploy resources or validate policies against a live cluster.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI or GitOps
faq.answer: Yes, you can generate manifests and apply them in your existing pipelines.

faq.question: Does it collect or send my data
faq.answer: No, it only provides static guidance and templates without data collection.

faq.question: What if routing rules do not apply
faq.answer: Use istioctl analyze and proxy-config commands to inspect config and endpoints.

faq.question: How is this different from Kubernetes Ingress
faq.answer: It adds mesh-aware routing, traffic shaping, and resilience policies.
